msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; a few lines, divided into three groups alternating with black lines, on the incipit of each text; sometimes the first lines of the account proper (e.g., fols. 81vb, 84vb, 97rb, 101ra, 105va); Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the punctuation signs and of coronis.

list.item: The quire structure cannot be established due to the condition of the binding. Fols. 1-3 were probably added later; fol. 103 is of a smaller size.

supportDesc.condition: Fols. 1-3 have been probably added later, in a more recent time. The Ms. was rebound. Most of the leaves are affected by humidity. Many leaves have stains in the inner upper margins (esp. fols. 133r-149v, 158r-159r, 161v-180r) and some others in the bottom margins (esp. fols. 2r-14r). Holes on fols. 57 and 151. Holes carefully repaired on fols. 48, 49, 81, 85, 182, 183, 193. Fol. 103 is of a smaller size. Fols. 132-133 are slightly damaged at the outer margins.

list.item: - Some of the names indicated in Additio 1 are mentioned throughout the Ms., nearly always in group of two or three. They are written, in the same hand as Additiones 1 and 2 and with the same ink, in the margins. The names are: Wäldä Ḥǝywät and Wälättä Ḥǝywät on fols. 14va, 58rb, 97rb, 107vb; Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät and Gäbrä Ḥǝywät on fols. 17ra, 19ra, 30va, 33vb, 61vb, 81va, 84va, 94rb, 100vb, 105va, 133va, 147vb, 152va, 153rb, 164ra, 171va, 188vb, 193rb, 198va. On fol. 175vb (below the text) Wäldä Ḥǝywät and Wälättä Ḥǝywät are mentioned together with Wälättä Mikaʾel and Rämḥa Śǝllase. On fol. 198va (upper margin) Kidanä Maryam is added to Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät and Gäbrä Ḥǝywät by a different hand and different ink. Besides, Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Mikaʾel, Rämḥa Śǝllase, Wälättä Maryam and Ṣǝllatä Muse are mentioned below the text on fol. 206r. Others names are crudely written in pencil and in a more recent hand (esp. fols. 94r, 100v, 105v, 107v, 133v, 153r, 165r, 171v, 175v, 193r, 206r). - Corrections written over erasures, throughout the Ms.: e.g., fols. 14rb, 16rb, 26rb, 136vb. - Lacunae on fol. 67rb and on fol. 169va. Probably the space was intentionally left empty, to be filled with ornamental bands later. In the blank spaces, a few black dots are visible possibly done as preliminary design for the ornamental bands (which were never executed). The lacunae are present in other parts of the Ms., e.g., on fols. 30vb, 34rab, 61vb, 67rb, 94vab, 147vb, 189ra, 193vab. - Crude notes and drawings in pencil are in the margins of fols. 30v, 57v, 82r and 156r. - Compressed script has been used for some of the corrections made by the scribe throughout the Ms. (e.g., fols. 35va, 137va, 137vb, 140va, 139vb, 177ra, 192va.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; leather inlays (a parchment pastedown is visible on the inner side of the back board; possibly there are remains of a parchment pastedown also on the inner side of the front board). Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of endband stitches through the spine cover. Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards of different length (or by strips of black cotton cloth).

origin.origDate: First half of the 16th cent. (?). Fols. 1-3 are maybe of a recent time (20th cent.?).

person.persName: Additio 2 (written in a 19th-cent. hand?) mentions gǝrazmač Gǝdäy as the donor of the book. Names of other individuals are listed in Additio 1 (fol. 28rb): Wäldä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Maryam, Rämḥa Śǝllase, Ṣǝllatä Muse, Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät, Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, Wäldä Maryam, Kidanä Maryam, Wäldä Ḥawaryat, Zä-Wäldä Maryam, Mäzgäbä Śǝllase, Gäbrä Kidan, Täklä Haymanot, Gäbrä Maryam. The names of Wäldä Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät and Gäbrä Ḥǝywät are also written throughout the Ms., most of the times all three, sometimes two of them (s. “Varia”).
